revised_title: Calcium's Vacuum Ultraviolet Absorption Spectrum: Excitation of the 3p-Subshell
tldr: The authors studied the calcium absorption spectrum in the vacuum ultraviolet region, focusing on the excitation of the 3p-subshell. They discovered at least 125 new calcium lines and found evidence of multi-electron excitation processes. The study used Hartree-Fock calculations to interpret the spectrum and understand the role of electron correlation in the valence and subvalence shells.
